name: Sanremo Ultra Trail SUT 60

Successivamente ricomincia una prima salita che arriva al monte Carparo a 900 mt s.l.m. dal quale si gode di una vista imprendibile dalla vicina Francia fino al capolugo Imperia; poi di seguito il monte Caggio a circa 1090mt (tratto comune alla 32K) il quale gode di una vista molto bella, ma e' anche sede di un luogo quasi magico presieduto da una Madonnina dopo di che si affronta un lungo tratto di discese che incrociano la cittadina di Perinaldo per proseguire fino a fondo valle, attraversato il Rio Merdanzo si comincia ad affrontare la salita fino all'abitato di Berzi (fontana) per poi affrontare una delle salite pi√π impegnative di questo tratto che porta a¬† percorrere un sentiero alle pendici del monte Bignone che si raccorda con il percorso della 32K il quale porta alla cima del monte posta a 1300 mt dal quale si domina sull'intera zona sia a mare che a monte. Infine si affronta una discesa a mare decisamente impegnativa, soprattutto nel primo tratto per poi addolcirsi successivamente.
Il terreno predominante¬† e' costituito da sentieri sigle track sterrati. Arrivo in piazza Cassini.

name: Scenic Trail K113 ULTRA

description: Uno sprint di pochissimi chilometri ma con un tracciato tutto da scoprire. A volte sembra di trovarsi in volo sopra Tesserete. name: UTMB World Series Finals - UTMB 170
description:
Prova in montagna che comporta numerosi passaggi in altitudine (>2500m), in condizioni che potrebbero essere molto difficili (notte, vento, freddo, pioggia o neve) e che necessita di un buon allenamento specifico, materiale adatto ed una reale capacit√† d'autonomia personale.

Alle 18:00 saremo pi√π di 2300 persone a condividere lo stesso sogno: fare il giro completo del Monte Bianco in meno di due giorni. Ognuno di noi si √® scrupolosamente preparato per molti mesi. Malgrado l'enormit√† della prova, siamo sereni perch√® sappiamo che quasi 2000 volontari partecipano con noi alla stessa avventura, pronti ad offrirci con passione il loro aiuto e conforto con spirito di solidariet√† e amicizia.
Andiamo quindi a vivere un'avventura fuori dal tempo!
Al chiaro di luna costeggeremo l'Aiguille de Bionnassay e supereremo il Col du Bonhomme. All'alba passeremo il col de la Seigne e entreremo in Italia nella magica Val Veny dominata dalla Noire de Peuterey e dai ghiacciai del Monte Bianco. Poi arriver√† la Val Ferret, dominata dal Dente del Gigante e dalle Grandes Jorasses, prima di scollinare in Svizzera e trovarsi in un ambiente naturale scrupolosamente curato.

Dovremo sopportare la fatica, superare i nostri dubbi e le nostre angosce. Ci saranno quelli che, raggiunto il limite estremo delle proprie forze, preferiranno abbandonare la corsa e rimanderanno il sogno di concludere questa prova la prossima volta.

Gli altri invece dovranno affrontare le salite di Bovine e Les Tseppes. Poi, davanti all'Aiguille Verte, alla verticale dei Drus ed alla maestosit√† del Monte Bianco, si lanceranno verso il traguardo, posto nel cuore di Chamonix.

Qualsiasi cosa ci capiter√†, ci ritroveremo tutti insieme domenica pomeriggio per festeggiare i vincitori, applaudire ancora pi√π forte l'ultimo arrivato e condividere ancora, corridori e volontari riuniti, le nostre gioie, la nostra sofferenza e le nostre grandi emozioni.

name: UTMB World Series Finals - CCC 100
description:

name: Dolomiti Extreme Trail 103K
description:
Una Odisea Alpina en el Coraz√≥n de las Dolomitas

La Dolomiti Extreme Trail (DXT) 103K es una de las pruebas m√°s desafiantes y espectaculares del panorama del trail running en Italia. Situada en la regi√≥n del Val di Zoldo, en el coraz√≥n de las majestuosas Dolomitas, esta carrera es una experiencia √©pica para quienes buscan un reto extremo rodeado de paisajes impresionantes y una atm√≥sfera √∫nica.
Un recorrido de leyenda

Con sus 103 kil√≥metros de distancia y un desnivel positivo que supera los 7.000 metros, el trazado de la DXT 103K atraviesa algunos de los paisajes m√°s emblem√°ticos de las Dolomitas, declaradas Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la UNESCO.

Desde el inicio, la ruta se sumerge en un terreno t√©cnico y exigente, ascendiendo a ic√≥nicos pasos de monta√±a y crestas que desaf√≠an tanto el f√≠sico como la mente de los corredores. A lo largo del recorrido, los participantes cruzan senderos de alta monta√±a, bordean lagos alpinos y se enfrentan a subidas imponentes, como las que llevan a las cimas del Civetta, Pelmo y Moiazza, que ofrecen vistas de postal y un contacto directo con la esencia pura de los Alpes italianos.
Un desaf√≠o solo para los m√°s preparados

La DXT 103K no es solo una prueba de resistencia, sino tambi√©n de estrategia y gesti√≥n del esfuerzo. Las largas ascensiones y los descensos t√©cnicos ponen a prueba la t√©cnica y la experiencia de los corredores. La altitud y los cambios de temperatura tambi√©n juegan un papel fundamental, con condiciones clim√°ticas que pueden variar desde el calor del d√≠a hasta temperaturas bajo cero en las zonas m√°s expuestas durante la noche.

Los participantes deben llevar un equipamiento obligatorio, incluyendo GPS con la ruta preinstalada, ya que la se√±alizaci√≥n es limitada en algunos tramos. La seguridad es una prioridad, y los puntos de avituallamiento est√°n estrat√©gicamente ubicados para permitir una correcta hidrataci√≥n y recuperaci√≥n durante la carrera.
El esp√≠ritu de la DXT

M√°s que una competici√≥n, la Dolomiti Extreme Trail es una experiencia que re√∫ne a corredores de todo el mundo en un ambiente de compa√±erismo y pasi√≥n por la monta√±a. La hospitalidad del Val di Zoldo, la calidez de los voluntarios y la belleza salvaje del entorno hacen de esta prueba una cita ineludible en el calendario del trail running.

name: DOPPIAW ULTRA - ULTRA 100K
description:
Partenza dal "DoppiaW Village" di Villa di Tirano.
Poche centinaia di metri tra i vicoli del paese e subito si sale.
Una antica mulattiera porta i concorrenti subito nel vivo del percorso.
Il primo ristoro alle luci delle lampade frontali √® quello di Lughina, dopo 5km di gara.
Si sale ancora verso il primo passo di giornata, Col d‚ÄôAnzana a 2220m slm che porta i concorrenti in Svizzera, da qui si prosegue verso il secondo ristoro, Capanna d‚ÄôAnzana.
Due stupendi laghetti alpini, Lag de la Regina e Lag dal Mat, fanno da sfondo a questa parte del tracciato che scende leggermente per poi risalire al Passo Tre Croci 2348m slm.
Da qui una bellissima discesa porta i partecipanti al Lago di Poschiavo passando dal ristoro di Torn.
Da Miralago inizia una nuova salita verso San Romerio, posto al km 35, ristoro e cancello orario delle 12 ore.
La salita continua verso il Passo Malghera 2540m slm, passando dal ristoro di Albertusch.
Dopo il valico che riporta i concorrenti in Italia ed un tratto di discesa, si arriva alla base vita del Rifugio Malghera (48km e cancello orario delle 15 ore).
Siamo nella magnifica Valgrosina ed i runners sono pronti ad affrontare il passaggio pi√π elevato di tutta la gara, Passo Vermolera posto a 2732m slm.
Da qui un paesaggio dapprima lunare lascer√† spazio alla bellezza dei lago Venere e dei Laghi di Tres, fino ad arrivare al ristoro di Vermolera.
Una breve salita condurr√† gli atleti in localit√† Biancadino e, attraversando la valle, sul versante opposto ad aspettare i concorrenti ci sar√† il Rifugio Casina di Piana.
E‚Äô tempo di entrare nella selvaggia Val Piana, che con un sentiero molto corribile, porter√† i concorrenti alla base del ripido single track del Passo di Schiazzera 2546m slm.
Da qui si scende verso il Rifugio di Schiazzera, cancello orario delle 24 ore di gara dove mancheranno 18km all‚Äôarrivo.
Una leggera salita sar√† il preludio di un bel sentiero in discesa, dapprima in quota e poi nel bosco.
Al ristoro di Pr√† Zar√® ci sar√† l‚Äôultima salita di giornata, l‚Äôultimo sforzo prima della discesa che da Pradentia condurr√† i partecipanti verso il ristoro di Tirano.
Ultimi 5 km, ultime fatiche e poi il traguardo di Villa di Tirano.

name: DOLOMYTHS RUN - ULTRA 61K
description: La gara si svolge attorno al Gruppo del Sella, percorrendo strade forestali e sentieri, cercando di evitare il pi√π possibile le strade asfaltate e limitando al massimo gli attraversamenti delle strade statali. Lo sviluppo √® di circa 61,5 km con un dislivello in salita di 3.378 m. Si partir√† da Canazei a 1.450 m per salire al Passo Sella a quota 2.200 m. Attraversando la ‚ÄúCitt√† dei Sassi ‚Äú si scende poi a Selva Val Gardena, 1.563 m, per poi risalire lungo la pista da sci Dantercepies a quota 2.276 m. Si prosegue scendendo verso Colfosco e Corvara, a 1.535 m, per poi salire verso il Bo√® fino a quota 2.192 m e successiva discesa verso Arabba a 1.598 m. Si riparte poi per la lunga salita verso il Passo Padon a quota 2.373 (quota pi√π alta della gara) e attraversando il Viel dal Pan si arriva al Passo Pordoi a quota 2235 m slm per poi affrontare l‚Äôultima discesa fino all‚Äôarrivo di Canazei a 1450 m slm.

description: Partenza da Colfosco e arrivo a Canazei, la gara si svolge attorno al Gruppo del Sella, percorrendo strade forestali e sentieri, cercando di evitare il pi√π possibile le strade asfaltate e limitando al massimo gli attraversamenti delle strade statali. name: Hotel Serena: Tradici√≥n y Encanto en el Coraz√≥n de Cortina
description:
El Hotel Serena es un hist√≥rico alojamiento presente en Cortina desde el lejano 1906.

Nos rodea una naturaleza espectacular: marmotas, √≠bices y ciervos que a menudo nos visitan en la explanada del hotel. En invierno, un manto de nieve impoluta lo cubre todo; en verano, el verde aterciopelado de los paisajes se ilumina con la calidez del sol. Kil√≥metros de pistas nevadas y senderos de trekking te esperan para una experiencia inolvidable.

Y, por supuesto, no podemos olvidar la gastronom√≠a: sabores aut√©nticos, ingredientes frescos y la calidad √∫nica de esta tierra.

Entonces, ¬øa qu√© esperas? D√©jate conquistar por la belleza de estas monta√±as y sus habitantes. ¬°Inf√≥rmate sobre nuestras promociones!

La vista √∫nica que se disfruta desde nuestro hotel cautiva a quienes llegan por primera vez y sigue fascinando a aquellos que, a√±o tras a√±o, no pueden evitar volver.

name: GRAN TRAIL COURMAYEUR - GTC 55K
description:
El Gran Trail Courmayeur 55 es una de las carreras m√°s accesibles y espectaculares del circuito de trail running en los Alpes, ofreciendo una combinaci√≥n perfecta de desaf√≠o y belleza natural. Con un recorrido de 55 km y un desnivel positivo de 3800 metros, la carrera se desarrolla principalmente en la impresionante Val Veny, atravesando algunos de los paisajes m√°s emblem√°ticos de Courmayeur y Pr√©-Saint-Didier.
Detalles del recorrido

La aventura comienza en el Courmayeur Mountain Sport Center (1250 m). Desde aqu√≠, el recorrido se dirige hacia las Fonti Vittoria y toma el sendero que lleva a Champex, en Pr√©-Saint-Didier. Una vez en el famoso pueblo termal, los corredores cruzar√°n la pasarela sobre el ‚Äúorrido‚Äù (garganta) y el parque de aventura, para luego ascender hacia el vall√≥n de Plan Praz. En este tramo, un sendero en falsoplano conduce al primer punto de avituallamiento en las ba√±as de Youlaz (2047 m).
Cumbres y paisajes alpinos

Desde el primer avituallamiento, los corredores seguir√°n parte del recorrido del legendario Tor des G√©ants¬Æ, alcanzando el Colle dell‚ÄôArp (2572 m) y el Colle di Youlaz (2661 m), hasta llegar al punto m√°s alto de la carrera bajo el majestuoso Mont Nix (2830 m). Este segmento ofrece vistas espectaculares y un desaf√≠o f√≠sico significativo.

El trayecto contin√∫a hacia el Colle du Berrio Blanc (2818 m) y el Mont Fortin (2755 m), donde encontrar√°n un avituallamiento en un bivac√≥ m√≥vil transportado en helic√≥ptero. Desde aqu√≠, los corredores bordear√°n lagos alpinos y se dirigir√°n hacia el Col Chavanne (2598 m), descendiendo luego al Col de la Seigne (2510 m) y las hist√≥ricas casermette (2290 m).

En este punto, la ruta bordea las impresionantes Pyramides Calcaires (2573 m) y llega al Rifugio Elisabetta (2197 m), un punto ic√≥nico del recorrido y otro avituallamiento clave.
La magia del Tour del Mont Blanc

Desde el Rifugio Elisabetta, el recorrido se une al Tour del Mont Blanc, descendiendo al Lago Combal (1952 m) y ascendiendo hacia Arp Vieille (2303 m). A lo largo de este tramo, los corredores podr√°n disfrutar de vistas al Lago Checrouit (2151 m) antes de llegar al Rifugio Maison Vieille (1952 m), el √∫ltimo punto de avituallamiento.
El tramo final

Desde el Rifugio Maison Vieille, la ruta asciende hacia la Courba Dzeleuna (2048 m) antes de comenzar un emocionante descenso hacia Plan Checrouit. Finalmente, los corredores regresar√°n al Courmayeur Mountain Sport Center, donde les espera la l√≠nea de meta y la celebraci√≥n del logro personal.
Un recorrido perfecto para todos los niveles

El Gran Trail Courmayeur 55 es una opci√≥n ideal para quienes desean disfrutar de una experiencia desafiante pero accesible, combinando ascensos espectaculares, descensos t√©cnicos y un contacto directo con la naturaleza salvaje de los Alpes.

Prep√°rate para descubrir la magia del trail running en el Mont Blanc y vive una aventura inolvidable en el Gran Trail Courmayeur 55.

name: VAL D'ARAN PYRENEES by UTMB - VDA 161K
description:
Starting at 4:00 pm and leaving Vielha, after just a few kilometres, you will conquer 3 summits above 2,000 meters. You will have the feeling of flying over Vielha and the whole valley. When the night falls, you will traverse Artiga de Lin, an exceptional natural space. Accompanied by the moon, you will cross Escaleta‚Äôs pass, Montjoia and you will link several peaks running over the ridge at 2,000 m until reaching Baretja‚Äôs pass. From there, through a steady descent, you will arrive to Boss√≤st, where you will find the first aid station with allowed assistance.

Fire is one of the most important elements of the Aranese culture, and Les is a population with deep-rooted traditions. Crossing the town, you can appreciate Eth Haro, a fir tree that is around 10 meters high, which is burned every Summer Solstice. From Les, you will get to the heart of Val de Toran, probably the wildest valley in the Aranese mountains. Close to sunrise, you will go through the ancient but charming villages of Toran, like Canejan and Sant Joan de Toran.

Early morning lights will transport you to the important mining past of Val d‚ÄôAran. A long ascent from Sant Joan de Toran will carry you to Liat‚Äôs lake. You will get close to Mauberme‚Äôs base, an important mountain of 2,880m. Port de Urets‚Äô passage, at 2,500m is one of the highest points of the race. A few meters away, and leaving behind the old mining tunnels, you will run through the antique iron mines of Urets, with panoramic views over Montoliu‚Äôs lake and the principal chain in the Pyrenees; Aneto and Maladetas, Montarto, Montlude‚Ä¶ After reaching Montoliu¬¥s pass, a long but easy descent will take you to Montgarri‚Äôs Sanctuary. From Montgarri, after a smooth ascent, you will arrive to Pla de Beret, marking the 100km point of the race, and where you will find the second life base. After traversing the plateau, at 1,800m above sea level, you will have to go down to the valley. Two villages will be waiting for you; Bagergue, declared one of the most beautiful villages in Spain, and Salard√∫, Naut Aran‚Äôs capital.

From Salard√∫ the landscape changes completely. You will go to the ‚ÄúParc Nacional d‚ÄôAig√ºestortes i Estany de Sant Maurici‚Äù. The climb up the Val d‚ÄôAiguamoix will take you to¬†Banhs de Tred√≤s, natural hot springs that are known since the Roman era, and which are the door to the National Park.¬†The Colom√®rs lake cirque, with its more than 50 lakes, is the largest glacial lake cirque in the Pyrenees. You will pass through several of them until you reach the Estanh Obago and, on the way down to the Estanh de Colomers, you will cross a water show with great views. You will leave the Colomers lake on your right to go down to the Colomers aid station and continue towards the Pruedo cabins to connect with the old water path that will offer you spectacular views over the Val de Valarties. Then you will descend through the Mont-Romies area to the beautiful town of Arties, where you will find the third aid station with allowed assistance (after Boss√≥st and Beret). From that place to the finish line, two last and demanding climbs will await you up to Santet de Escunhau and tuc de Cauva. There you will have the finish line in Vielha at your feet. A few last kilometers of trail going down through the forest will take you to the end of the challenge.

name: Camins de H√®r by UTMB¬Æ (Vall D'Aran by UTMB)
description:

Con 110 km de recorrido, el CDH es un aut√©ntico ultra-trail que atraviesa el Val d'Aran de sur a norte, explorando senderos t√©cnicos, pasos de alta monta√±a y valles escondidos. La carrera arranca en Les, una localidad con gran tradici√≥n y cultura aranesa, y sigue un itinerario que conecta algunos de los paisajes m√°s ic√≥nicos de la regi√≥n, como el Port de Urets (2.500 m), el Montpius y los senderos que serpentean los valles glaciares.

El trazado es un constante desaf√≠o f√≠sico y mental, con ascensos prolongados, descensos t√©cnicos y tramos donde la naturaleza virgen domina el escenario. La llegada a Vielha, capital del valle, es un momento de gloria para todos los corredores que logran completar esta exigente aventura.

El CDH destaca no solo por su exigencia t√©cnica, sino tambi√©n por su espectacularidad. A lo largo del recorrido, los corredores atraviesan praderas alpinas, crestas escarpadas, bosques centenarios y lagos de origen glaciar, en un entorno donde la monta√±a se muestra en su estado m√°s puro.

Adem√°s, la historia y la cultura del Val d‚ÄôAran est√°n presentes en cada tramo del recorrido, con antiguos caminos de contrabandistas, pueblos de arquitectura tradicional y paisajes que han sido testigos del paso de generaciones de pastores y monta√±eros.

El Camins de H√®r by UTMB¬Æ no es una carrera para principiantes: sus desniveles acumulados, los terrenos irregulares y la impredecible meteorolog√≠a pirenaica lo convierten en una prueba para corredores con experiencia en monta√±a. Sin embargo, es tambi√©n una de las experiencias m√°s gratificantes del circuito, una aventura en la que cada paso acerca al corredor a la esencia misma del trail running.

Formando parte del prestigioso circuito UTMB¬Æ World Series, el CDH es una prueba clave para los corredores que buscan desafiar sus l√≠mites en un entorno √∫nico. Con una organizaci√≥n impecable, servicios de primer nivel y un ambiente espectacular, esta carrera representa la perfecta fusi√≥n entre deporte, aventura y naturaleza.
Un Viaje Inolvidable por el Coraz√≥n del Pirineo

El Camins de H√®r es mucho m√°s que una carrera: es una invitaci√≥n a recorrer los caminos ancestrales del Val d‚ÄôAran, a vivir la alta monta√±a en su m√°xima expresi√≥n y a formar parte de una comunidad de corredores unidos por la pasi√≥n por el trail running.

name: VAL D'ARAN PYRENEES by UTMB - PDA 55K
description: The departure will take place in the town of Salard√∫, capital of the Naut Aran, from where a constant climb towards Colomers will begin. You will go to the National Park of ‚ÄúAig√ºestortes i Estany de Sant Maurici‚Äù. The Banhs de Tred√≤s, ancient thermal baths known to the Romans, will open the doors of the national park. The Colom√®rs lake cirque, with its more than 50 lakes, forms the largest glacial lake cirque in the Pyrenees. You will pass through more than 20 lakes, crowning the P√≤do pass, the highest point of the route, at 2,600 meters of altitude. On the way down to Estanh de Colomers, you will go through a water show and endless views. You will leave the Colomers lake on the right to go down to the Colomers aid station and face the ascent towards Pas de Ribareta, part of the GR-11, to culminate at the top of the Salana tuc, with an impressive panoramic view of the entire Val d ‚Äò Aran. name: VAL D'ARAN PYRENEES by UTMB - SKY 15K
description:
There is no place more magical and with more historic background than Pla de Beret. A great plateau at 1.860 meters above sea level and about 4km long, that in winter becomes a snow sports centre and in summer, cattle graze freely. Former area of witches‚Äô covens, and with archaeological remains of the Bronze Age. Birth of two rivers; the Garonne, which flows into the French Atlantic, and the Noguera Pallaresa, which flows into the Mediterranean. A plateau covered with snow more than half a year, that in summer explodes with intense green colours and the mountains watching it.

Starting there, the SKY Baqueira Beret will take you through Parros‚Äô valley to Cap de Cl√≤sos (2.418 masl), to enjoy one of the best views of Val d‚ÄôAran. You will continue running through the ridge and crossing several peaks until you ascend to Cap dera S√®rra (2.248m). All the time you will be accompanied by awesome views over the central mountains of the Pyrenees, with the Aneto in the background (highest peak in the Pyrenees). In Cap dera S√®rra you will find one of the aid stations and Blanhiblar‚Äôs chairlift. This chairlift and its bar will be open during the race and supporters will be able to go up to watch their runners pass and encourage them. From Cap dera S√®rra, you will only need to go down again towards Pla de Beret. 15km and 800m of ascent by the heights of Pla de Beret.

Moreover, during the race, the¬†Trail Festival Baqueira Beret¬†will be taking place in the departure and arrival area, so you will be able to enjoy a perfect day for all the family and friends. Oh! And Beret is also a passing point for VDA 162km runners, so stay and encourage all participants who will carry already more than 100km on their legs!

name: Grand Trail du Saint Jacques by UTMB - 100K
description:
Una Peregrinaci√≥n Trailera por la V√≠a Podiensis

La Saint Jacques 100K es una de las carreras m√°s emblem√°ticas dentro del Saint Jacques by UTMB, un evento que sigue los hist√≥ricos pasos de los peregrinos en la V√≠a Podiensis, una de las rutas m√°s antiguas del Camino de Santiago en Francia. Desde su inicio en el coraz√≥n de la regi√≥n de Auvernia, la Saint Jacques 100K sumerge a los corredores en un entorno de contrastes: desde mesetas volc√°nicas hasta profundos valles verdes, pasando por senderos rurales y antiguas calzadas romanas. name: Eiger Ultra Trail By UTMB - E101
description:
Un desaf√≠o legendario en los Alpes suizos

El Eiger Ultra Trail E101 es la distancia reina de este prestigioso evento que tiene como epicentro el ic√≥nico pueblo de Grindelwald, Suiza. Con un recorrido de m√°s de 100 kil√≥metros y miles de metros de desnivel positivo, esta carrera no solo desaf√≠a la resistencia f√≠sica y mental de los corredores, sino que tambi√©n les brinda una experiencia inolvidable en uno de los entornos alpinos m√°s espectaculares del mundo.
Historia y esp√≠ritu de la competici√≥n

Desde su creaci√≥n, el Eiger Ultra Trail ha sido una referencia en el mundo del trail running, atrayendo a corredores de √©lite y aficionados por igual. Su nombre hace honor al majestuoso Eiger (3.967 m), una de las monta√±as m√°s ic√≥nicas de los Alpes, cuya cara norte ha sido el escenario de innumerables haza√±as alpin√≠sticas. La carrera busca capturar ese esp√≠ritu de aventura y resistencia, llevando a los participantes a lo largo de una ruta que combina la dureza del terreno con la belleza de los paisajes alpinos.
El recorrido: Un viaje a trav√©s de los Alpes

El trazado del E101 es un espect√°culo en s√≠ mismo. La carrera parte de Grindelwald, un pintoresco pueblo suizo rodeado de imponentes picos, y se adentra en una traves√≠a √©pica que incluye pasos de alta monta√±a, crestas expuestas y senderos t√©cnicos entre glaciares y valles alpinos. Los corredores ascienden hasta puntos emblem√°ticos como el Faulhorn (2.681 m), desde donde se obtiene una vista panor√°mica de los glaciares y cumbres que dominan la regi√≥n.

Los desaf√≠os no terminan ah√≠: el Paso de Grosse Scheidegg y los senderos a lo largo de la m√≠tica cara norte del Eiger ponen a prueba tanto la resistencia como la destreza t√©cnica de los participantes. La combinaci√≥n de grandes desniveles, terrenos exigentes y cambios de temperatura hacen que esta carrera sea un verdadero reto incluso para los m√°s experimentados.
El clima y la preparaci√≥n: Factores clave

El clima alpino es impredecible y puede cambiar en cuesti√≥n de minutos. Desde sol radiante hasta lluvias torrenciales o incluso nevadas en las cumbres, los corredores deben estar preparados para cualquier condici√≥n. La estrategia de carrera, la gesti√≥n del esfuerzo y el equipo adecuado juegan un papel fundamental en el √©xito de quienes se enfrentan a este desaf√≠o.
Una meta inolvidable en Grindelwald

Finalizar la Eiger Ultra Trail E101 es una haza√±a que queda grabada en la memoria de cada corredor. El ambiente en la l√≠nea de meta en Grindelwald es electrizante, con corredores, espectadores y voluntarios celebrando juntos la grandeza del trail running en los Alpes suizos.

name: EIGER ULTRA TRAIL by UTMB - E250 UNESCO Jungfrau-Aletsch Trail 250K
description:
E250 UNESCO Jungfrau-Aletsch Trail

Imposing mountain ranges, rustic valleys and the largest connected glaciated area in the¬†Alps - This is a World Heritage of universal value. On the UNESCO Jungfrau-Aletsch Trail,¬†participants in teams of 2 or 3 can discover the UNESCO World Heritage Swiss Alps¬†Jungfrau-Aletsch.

With 250 kilometers as well as 20,000 meters of altitude, the E250 route is considered a¬†tough test for all participants. We pass by Sefinafurgga, Hoht√ºrli next to Bl√ºemlisalph√ºtte, Gasterental and L√∂tschepass, Suonenwege im Wallis, Blatten-Belalp, Aletschgletscher, Fieschergletscher, Goms, Grimselpass, Haslital and Rosenlaui. The competition takes place in partial autonomy which means¬†that each athlete has the ability to manage between the food and control posts, regardingfood, equipment, orientation and safety.¬†The circumnavigation of the UNESCO World Heritage Swiss Alps Jungfrau-Aletsch is a huge¬†challenge for the athletes and will therefore be run in teams of 2 or 3 for safety reasons (whole route).

On the course there are Life bases, where the athletes can get food and rest. In addition,¬†there will be refreshment facilities along the course. As a participant you will feed yourself¬†independently between the posts and must carry the mandatory gear as stated in the¬†race regulations.

name: EIGER ULTRA TRAIL by UTMB - E51 Panorama Trail 51K
description:
E51 Panorama Trail

Although aptly named the Panorama Trail, the first ascent towards Grosse Scheidegg should not be underestimated. Once reached, the spectacular scenery along the route to Oberl√§ger via First and Bachalpsee, the 360¬∞ panorama atop the Faulhorn summit at 2680m, and the views to the horizon on route to Schynige Platte, definitely compensate for all the effort and remain long in the memory.

The E51 trail should be completed under the partial self-support principle. This means that as a competitor you are responsible for your own food and drinks¬†between check-points and refreshment zones and must carry the mandatory gear as stated in the¬†Race Regulations.

name: EIGER ULTRA TRAIL by UTMB - E51 Panorama Trail - Couples 51K
description:
E51 Panorama Trail - Couples

Although rightly named as the E51 Panorama Trail the first ascent towards the Grosse Scheidegg shouldn‚Äôt be underestimated. The spectacular views however, along the sections to Oberl√§ger via First and Bachalpsee and the panoramic views from the Faulhorn summit at 2680m or the views to the horizon as the couples make their way towards the Schynige Platte, will compensate for all the effort and make it an unforgettable experience. Shared pain - double the pleasure! The E51 is also available for couples. Go for the team spirit and the collective experience. Handle as team the individual highs and lows during the course.
The E51 trail must be accomplished under the partial self-support principle. This means that in between the check-points you as a couple are responsible for your own food and drinks and must carry the mandatory gear as stated in the race¬†regulations.

name: EIGER ULTRA TRAIL by UTMB - E35 North Face Trail 35K
description:
E35 North Face Trail

The E35 delivers its competitors to the very foot of the imposing Eiger north face. The trail winds its way up via Sp√§tenalp to Wengen then continues steeply up the infamous Gemsenweg, or ‚Äòchamois way‚Äô to finally top-out on the M√§nnlichen ridge, where the rewards are boundless, breath-taking views deep into the enchanting Lauterbrunnen valley below. With the 3 peaks of the Eiger, M√∂nch and Jungfrau as a constant backdrop now, the race moves on towards Kleine Scheidegg and the glacier moraine below Eigergletscher, at which point a sharp turn brings you abruptly onto the traverse below the looming Eiger north face. There is truly no better place to experience the glacial winds and ancient limestone facets of the Eiger than here. The E35 route then descends the Eiger Trail to Trychelegg and on to the finish in Grindelwald.

The E35 trail should be completed under the partial self-support principle. This means that as a competitor you are responsible for your own food and drinks between check-points and refreshment zones and must carry the mandatory gear as stated in the Race Regulations.

name: EIGER ULTRA TRAIL by UTMB - E16 Pleasure Trail 16K
description:
E16 Pleasure Trail

The E16 is perfect for short distance specialists, and for those wishing to enjoy a shorter trail at their leisure! The trail starts out towards the Wetterhorn and when it reaches Winteregg (above Bort) at 1600m, the max altitude is almost already in the bag. From here, the trail leads through alternating sections of forest, small gorges and sweeping meadows via Bort, Nodhalten and Holewang, ending with a spritely downhill back into Grindelwald.

The trail is so well located that it is possible for you to hike or to train on for around 8 months of the year, weather conditions permitting. Since December 2016, the E16 route is marked.

A lo largo del recorrido, los corredores atraviesan lugares ic√≥nicos como el Coll d‚ÄôArenes, el Estany de l'Angonella y el espectacular Vall del Riu, donde el ambiente alpino se siente en cada paso.

Adem√°s, el clima de los Pirineos puede ser impredecible, con cambios bruscos de temperatura, vientos fuertes y posibles precipitaciones. La preparaci√≥n es crucial para afrontar las condiciones que pueden presentarse en plena carrera.
Un final √©pico en el coraz√≥n de Andorra

Cruzar la meta en Ordino, tras m√°s de 100 kil√≥metros de aventura, es un momento inolvidable. La comunidad del trail se re√∫ne para celebrar cada llegada, en un ambiente de emoci√≥n, orgullo y respeto por la monta√±a.

name: TRAIL 100 ANDORRA by UTMB - TRAIL 50K
description: We will leave the Ordino church square towards the Segudet track where we will go up to the Coll d‚ÄôOrdino, here we will find the first aid station and then we will continue towards Pic del Casamanya until the 2350m level where we will deviate to cross the entire Casamanya where We will enjoy spectacular and unparalleled views over the valley. The second ascent of the day will take us through the Coll de les Cases passing through the Bordes dels Prats Nous and up to the Pla de l‚ÄôEstany Refuge, where we will find a refreshment station. We will continue along the trails, rivers and bridges of the natural park that will lead us to the guarded refuge of Comapedrosa where we will find the fourth aid station. We will go around the Trout Lake to Portella de Sanfons and an easy descent will take us to Coll de la Botella, where a refreshment station will allow us to regain strength to face the last part of the race. description: A route of medium difficulty. We will leave the square of the church of Ordino towards the Segudet track and we will go up to the Coll d‚ÄôOrdino, here we will find the first aid station and then we will continue towards the Pic de Casamanya until the 2350m level where we will deviate to cross the Casamanya with some spectacular and unrivaled views over the entire valley. The Family 7.5k offers an attractive route at an accessible difficulty for runners of all levels. Its most prominent point is the Roc de la Cauba, a panoramic balcony over the valley of the north of the Principality.

Once in Sorn√†s, athletes will take the GR11 that will take them to the Creu de Noral, reaching the first aid station with spectacular views of Ordino.From here they will start the second ascent along the Cam√≠ dels Aubells, going down along the river Segudet. Once in the river, a last small climb will take them to the magical forest called Bosc Viu, where they will reach the finish line in the city of Ordino.

name: WESTERN STATES ENDURANCE RUN - 100 MILES
description:
The Western States ¬Æ 100-Mile Endurance Run is the world‚Äôs oldest 100 mile trail race. The Run starts in Olympic Valley, California, near the site of the 1960 Winter Olympics, and ends 100.2 miles later in Auburn, California. In the decades since its inception in 1974, Western States has come to represent one of the ultimate endurance tests in the world.

Traversing the traditional lands of the Nisenan, Washoe, and other neighboring Indigenous Peoples, the Western States Trail climbs more than 18,000 feet and descends nearly 23,000 feet before runners reach the finish at Placer High School in Auburn. In the miles between Olympic Valley and Auburn, runners experience the majestic high country of Emigrant Pass and the Granite Chief Wilderness, the crucible of the canyons of the California gold country, a memorable crossing of the ice cold waters of the Middle Fork of the American River, and finally the historic reddish brown trails that led many travelers, including gold prospectors, to Auburn.

For almost five decades, Western States has been home to some of the sport‚Äôs most stirring and legendary competitions. With more than 1,500 dedicated volunteers helping to create a once-in-a-lifetime experience, the Run has stirred the spirit of runners from all walks of life, from all over the globe.

Offering the sport‚Äôs oldest and most prized possession ‚Äì a sub-24-hour silver belt buckle and a sub-30-hour bronze belt buckle ‚Äì Western States remains one of the undisputed crown jewels of human endurance.

name: THAILAND by UTMB - INTHANON 6 - 168K
description:
This race will give the opportunity for runners to circle around Doi Inthanon.

Start at Doi Inthanon National Park Headquarters 13:00 of Friday 10 December, 2021.

From the start, runners will run along the concrete road passing through Khun Klang Village - Doi Sure Ya then follow the ranger patrol route to Pha Mon Kao and Khun Wang Villages. From there, runners will make a steep climb up Pha Ngam, also known as Two-Seasons Cliff. On the mountain top, at 2,060 meters above sea level, the breathtaking, panoramic 360-degree view is waiting for all runners. Then, runners will descend to Pa Kluay Village along the dirt and concrete road all the way to Pong Noi Mai, Pong Noi Kao, Puay, and Muang Ang Villages to the lowest point of the race at 400 meters above sea level, skirting the Mae Teen-Mae Taeng stream to Park Ranger Check-Point 1. Here runners will be treated to a view of the gorgeous Mae Klang Waterfall.

The route then follows the pilgrimage trail formerly used by the Buddhist monk, Viriyong and his followers, and then passes through a dry Dipterocarp forest to Mae Aab Nai Village, before proceeding to aid station at Mae Klang Luang Village, and the Paganyaw hill tribe settlement.

Then the route will take runners on a climb up to Pha Tang for the sublime view of Doi Hua Sua. Khun Mae Ya Royal Project, and further on to Mae Aum Watershed Management Unit, where the pine forest and banana tree plantations are mixed. The route will then descend to Mae Samsob, Mae Rak, and Pa Pong Piang Villages before climbing up along the ridge line to the highest point of the route where runners will encounter two adjacent chedis, Naphamethinidon, and Naphaphonphumisiri. These temples were built to honour the 60th birthday anniversary of King Bhumibol Adulyadej in 1987, and the 60th birthday anniversary of Queen Sirikit in 1992, respectively. The last section will come down the hill through the Jeep Track route before arriving at the finish line.

name: TRAIL VERBIER ST-BERNARD by UTMB - X-ALPINE 140K
description:
The X-Alpine is changing! The organisers are giving new imputs to the race, with a balanced km-gradient ratio.

The start is at 22.00 from Verbier, the first ascent leads you to La Pierre Avoi and then downhill to Sembrancher. From there the route wanders through a number of small mountain villages to Champex, then moves on towards the Cabane d‚ÄôOrny which marks the highest point of the race (2826m), among the glaciers. The race continues, passing through La Fouly, the Lacs de Fen√™tre, the legendary Col du Grand St-Bernard, the Col des Chevaux and the Col de Mille.¬† The run to Panossi√®re in its majestic setting is the most beautiful part of the race. All that remains is to climb the famous 1200m wall before crossing the finish line in Verbier.

Con salida en La Fouly y llegada en Verbier, este desaf√≠o es una invitaci√≥n a vivir la aut√©ntica experiencia de correr en alta monta√±a, con un recorrido exigente que combina altas cumbres, valles glaciares y pasos alpinos que han forjado la historia del trail en los Alpes.

 ‚Ä¢ El Grand Saint-Bernard, un puerto de monta√±a con siglos de historia, famoso por su hospitalidad y sus ic√≥nicos perros San Bernardo.

El clima en los Alpes puede cambiar en cuesti√≥n de minutos, pasando de un sol radiante a tormentas inesperadas, lo que a√±ade un componente extra de dificultad y aventura a la prueba.

Tras superar los retos de la alta monta√±a, los corredores llegan a Verbier, una de las mecas del trail running en Suiza. La llegada es una celebraci√≥n del esfuerzo y la perseverancia, con un ambiente √∫nico que re√∫ne a la comunidad del trail en un marco incomparable.

name: TRAIL VERBIER ST-BERNARD by UTMB - VERBIER MARATHON 45K
description: For this year the additional 600m to Mt Rogneux is now fully part of the main race and the shorter route becomes the alternative. Both Marathons start in Liddes and the main race will continue up to the top of Mt Rogneux (3084m). The trail then goes down alongside some mountain lakes to reach the Brunet hut where the race continues towards Panossi√®res, with its suspension bridge and its glaciers. At the end of the trail, you‚Äôll still have to face the wall: the Lourtier-La Chaux ascent to be allowed to go down to Verbier and pass the finish line.

name: TRAIL VERBIER ST-BERNARD by UTMB - X-PLORE 26K
description:
This race has been especially designed as an introduction to trail running. It is suitable for any kind of runners and isn‚Äôt technically too difficult, while offering superb and extensive views of Verbier.

The race starts from the centre of the resort then, after a first climb towards Pierre Avoi, well known for its panoramic picture-postcard views, the route takes a splendid hillside path to Attelas, continues to the Cabane Mont-Fort and then follows a section of the charming Bisse du Levron irrigation channel. The Verbier X-Plore then joins the other races‚Äô route and finishes by crossing Verbier.

El desnivel acumulado y la altitud ser√°n un reto constante, exigiendo una gesti√≥n eficiente del esfuerzo y una gran capacidad de adaptaci√≥n a los cambios meteorol√≥gicos.

El clima en esta zona de los Alpes es impredecible, con temperaturas que pueden oscilar desde el calor en los valles hasta el fr√≠o extremo en los pasos m√°s elevados. Los corredores deber√°n estar preparados para enfrentarse a la lluvia, el viento y posibles nevadas, a√±adiendo una capa extra de dificultad y aventura.

Despu√©s de una traves√≠a exigente, la llegada a Crans-Montana es una celebraci√≥n del esfuerzo y la pasi√≥n por el trail. name: WILDSTRUBEL by UTMB - WILD 50K
description: The start will be from Adelboden in the heart of the canton of Bern to Crans-Montana in the canton of Valais. On the first part, the runners will take the famous Via Alpina through the well-tended alpine pastures of the Bernese Oberland to reach the village of Lenk. This is followed by a magnificent but demanding 1400m+ climb, with passages on the side of the cliffs to reach the Rawil Pass (2,427m). The last section in a downhill profile takes you along the sublime lake of Tzeuzier to reach the vertiginous and no less splendid Bisse du Ro. A change of scenery guaranteed!

name: WILDSTRUBEL by UTMB - WILD 23K
description: On this short and ultra-energetic format, the runners will have a condensed version of the Valais atmosphere: bucolic passages through the alpine pastures, exhilarating forest trails, breathtaking views of the 4000 of the Valais, historical paths along the Bisse‚Ä¶ Indeed, the "small" race of the weekend has all the makings of a big one!

name: Julian Alps - I Feel Slovenia120K

La traves√≠a √©pica de los Alpes Julianos

El Julian Alps 120K es un desaf√≠o extremo que pone a prueba la resistencia y habilidad de los corredores en un entorno de gran belleza y dificultad t√©cnica. Una prueba de ultra resistencia en la alta monta√±a

La Julian Alps 120K es una de las carreras m√°s exigentes del circuito UTMB, no solo por su distancia, sino tambi√©n por su acumulado de desnivel y la naturaleza t√©cnica del terreno. Los participantes deber√°n enfrentarse a subidas largas y exigentes, as√≠ como descensos t√©cnicos en los que la concentraci√≥n ser√° clave para superar el reto con √©xito.

El clima en los Alpes Julianos puede ser impredecible, con cambios bruscos de temperatura y la posibilidad de lluvias intensas o incluso nieve en las zonas m√°s altas. Esto a√±ade un componente de desaf√≠o adicional, obligando a los corredores a gestionar bien su equipo y resistencia.

Despu√©s de recorrer algunos de los paisajes m√°s bellos de los Alpes Julianos, la carrera finaliza en Kranjska Gora, una pintoresca localidad alpina que recibe a los finishers con una calurosa bienvenida. name: ULTRA TRAIL JULIAN ALPS - BITE ME SKY TRAIL 60
description:
Ultra Sky Trail will take place on a completely new route. You‚Äôll start in the village ≈Ωirovnica, cultural capital os Slovenia and then the route will take you across peaks, offering stunning views and to the finish line in Kranjska Gora.

You‚Äôll begin your race from the village ≈Ωirovnica, cultural capital of Slovenia. Few meters higher, you can see lake Bled, with an island in the midle. Then your route takes you to the highest point of your race ‚Äì Stol, and can already be seen from Zavr≈°nica valley. With its 2236 meters, Stol is the highest peak in your way. Don‚Äôt forget to take some pictures from the highest point of your race, because it‚Äôll offer breathtaking views of Julian Alps.

Your next stop from Stol is going across the ridge, right to Golica and Dov≈°ka baba. From there you have a great downhill in store, taking you straigt to Mojstrana. A flat section follows next, but you still have some climbing to do ‚Äì you‚Äôll pass the Jerman waterfall, climb Srednji vrh and then return to Kranjska Gora.

There will be many stunning views of not only Julian Alps, but also Austrian mountains and valleys.

Start: ≈Ωirovnica
Finish: Kranjska Gora
*some minor changes to the course are possible.

Distance: 58¬†km

name: ULTRA TRAIL JULIAN ALPS -SPEED TRAIL 15
description:
The first part of the trail takes you on the same route as the 10 km, but then extends to give you some more fun beneath the stunning peaks of Julian Alps. The route is easy, with some short technical sections, that will make you appreciate those mountain views even more.

The first part of the trail takes you on the same route as the 10 km race. You‚Äôll start in the heart of Kranjska Gora, go to the river Pi≈°nica and then pass the stunning lake Jasna. The route also goes through Tofov graben, but just when the shortest route starts making its way back to Kranjska Gora, you turn right to Gozd Martuljek, where you cross the main road right under the bridge and climb Srednji vrh, while passing the lower Jerman waterfall. That‚Äôs where you get a stunning view of the Julian Alps, which will follow you right back to the finish line.

name: ULTRA TRAIL JULIAN ALPS -FUNNY TRAIL 10
description:
Easy, but not even a bit less attractive trail is perfect for runners, who are still getting to know trail running. The route, during which you stay on the edge of Triglav National Park, is mostly a wide cart track, but it still gives you the feel of real mountain routes and the view of magnificent mountain ≈†pik in the background.

10 kilometers with start in the center of Kranjska Gora and take you to river Pi≈°nica. You pass the stunning lake Jasna next, where you simply have to hit pause and take a beautiful running selfie. From there you slowly continue towards the route‚Äôs highest point. You go through Tofov graben and continue towards Gozd Martuljek. The last segment might be flat, but offers amazing views of the mountains, including the magnificent ≈†pik. The route‚Äôs terrain might be easy, but it‚Äôs still a beautiful combination of road running, cart tracks and single trails.

Distance: 10,6 km

name: NICE C√îTE D'AZUR by UTMB - 100M
description: An iconic distance, the 100 miles race starts from Auron and quickly reaches the highest point of the course at more than 2,650 meters above sea level: the Rabuons and its unique mineral landscapes along the Chemin de l‚ÄôEnergie. After winding through chestnut forests and the meandering Tin√©e river, you will walk along the wonders of the Mercantour massif and then cross beautiful ridges at the halfway point at more than 2,000m above sea level. Then, head south through more Mediterranean landscapes. A last effort to cross the 4 mounts: Mont Leuze, Mont Vinaigrier, Mont Alban and Mont Boron, and at the bend of a steep staircase, you will find yourself by the sea, a magical landscape so different from anything you have ever seen. The final stretch along the coast will take you to the coveted finish on the Promenade des Anglais!

La Nice 100K, dentro del circuito Nice C√¥te d‚ÄôAzur by UTMB, es una carrera √∫nica que fusiona la majestuosidad de los Alpes Mar√≠timos con la brisa del Mar Mediterr√°neo. A lo largo del recorrido, se atraviesan bosques mediterr√°neos, crestas de monta√±a y antiguas rutas pastorales, proporcionando un reto tanto f√≠sico como mental.

Entre los puntos ic√≥nicos destacan los pasos de Col de Turini, las subidas a las cumbres del Parque Nacional del Mercantour, y el descenso final hacia el ic√≥nico Paseo de los Ingleses, donde los finishers cruzan la meta junto al mar en un ambiente vibrante y festivo.

A pesar de su ubicaci√≥n en la Riviera Francesa, la Nice 100K es un aut√©ntico ultra alpino. Su perfil exigente combina terrenos t√©cnicos con secciones de puro skyrunning, lo que la convierte en una prueba dura pero espectacular. Adem√°s de la exigencia t√©cnica, el terreno mixto a√±ade un reto adicional: los corredores alternan entre senderos pedregosos, pistas forestales y tramos de bajada vertiginosa que requieren m√°xima concentraci√≥n.

El tramo final de la carrera es una recompensa en s√≠ misma. Tras descender de las monta√±as, los corredores llegan al coraz√≥n de Niza, donde son recibidos con el entusiasmo del p√∫blico local. name: NICE C√îTE D'AZUR by UTMB - 50K
description: Superb 58km course and 3400m+ starting from Menton which dominates the Mediterranean from start to finish. Starting with a vertical ascent to the Col du Berceau, you will admire the pretty Borrigo waterfall before crossing the medieval village of Sainte-Agn√®s to reach the Cime de Baudon - at 1266m ‚Äì with a 360¬∞ view on Corsica and the Mercantour peaks. After several kilometers on the peaks via the Fort de la Rev√®re and the Mont Bataille, dive towards the Mediterranean for a grandiose finale on the Promenade des Anglais.

name: NICE C√îTE D'AZUR by UTMB - 20K
description: On the most accessible race of the event you will set off from Villefranche-sur-Mer to ride around Cap Ferrat, following the path that runs along the coastline and its many limestone creeks. You will then head for Aire St Michel and the Col 4 Chemins before heading back to the Mediterranean. Then, climb the hill of the Ch√¢teau via the old town of Nice to admire the Baie des Anges and reach the finish line at the famous Promenade des Anglais.

name: STRANDA FJORD TRAIL RACE - SFTR 100K
description: This wildest of our fjord trail courses and¬† probably one of the most scenic and challenging 100K¬¥s out there. This course takes you on a loop from Stranda and Storfjorden, to the iconic mt. Slogen and it¬¥s majestic view of Hj√∏rundfjorden and back to Stranda for the finish. You will be running on flowy singel trail in lush valleys, technical off trail and alpine ridges high above the fjord. And off course there¬¥s some easy scrambling at times, we are in the Sunnm√∏re alps after all.

name: STRANDA FJORD TRAIL RACE - SFTR 48K
description: The wilder fjord trail course.¬† The 48K adds even more flowy trails, more lung and leg burning climbs, more thrilling technical downhill sections than our 25K offers. And you even get more of our awesome fjord and mountain views.

name: Stranda Fjord Trail Race 25K
description:
Una traves√≠a √©pica en el coraz√≥n de los fiordos noruegos

La Stranda Fjord Trail Race 25K es mucho m√°s que una carrera de monta√±a; es una inmersi√≥n total en la majestuosidad de los fiordos noruegos, donde los corredores desaf√≠an la gravedad en terrenos t√©cnicos y disfrutan de vistas espectaculares que parecen sacadas de un cuento n√≥rdico. Esta prueba, que forma parte del prestigioso Stranda Fjord Trail Race, es el punto de encuentro perfecto entre aventura, resistencia y belleza natural.

Un recorrido espectacular con vistas inolvidables

Desde la salida, la Stranda Fjord Trail Race 25K lleva a los corredores por un trazado exigente que serpentea a trav√©s de prados alpinos, crestas afiladas y senderos t√©cnicos esculpidos en la roca. A medida que los participantes ganan altura, el espect√°culo visual se despliega en todo su esplendor: los profundos fiordos azules, las monta√±as que emergen de las aguas y los glaciares que brillan a lo lejos crean un paisaje de ensue√±o que solo Noruega puede ofrecer.

El recorrido combina tramos de ascenso exigente con descensos t√©cnicos que ponen a prueba la destreza y el control de los corredores. La cumbre de Roaldshorn (1230m) es uno de los puntos m√°s ic√≥nicos del trazado, donde el esfuerzo se ve recompensado con una panor√°mica que corta la respiraci√≥n. Desde all√≠, la bajada es una explosi√≥n de adrenalina hasta las orillas del fiordo, donde la naturaleza se muestra en su m√°xima expresi√≥n.

Una experiencia inmersiva en la naturaleza n√≥rdica

Lo que distingue a la Stranda Fjord Trail Race 25K es su capacidad de ofrecer una experiencia pura de trail running en alta monta√±a, en un entorno salvaje y poco intervenido por el ser humano. Es una carrera donde cada paso es un descubrimiento, donde la monta√±a dicta las reglas y donde la conexi√≥n con la naturaleza es total.

El clima en esta regi√≥n puede cambiar r√°pidamente, lo que a√±ade un elemento extra de aventura a la prueba. Los corredores deben estar preparados para enfrentar desde sol radiante hasta niebla densa y r√°fagas de viento, lo que convierte la carrera en un desaf√≠o din√°mico y emocionante.

Un reto accesible pero desafiante

A pesar de su distancia "intermedia", la Stranda Fjord Trail Race 25K no es una carrera para subestimar. name: STRANDA FJORD TRAIL RACE - SFTR 12K

name: PIKES PEAK - MARATHON 42K
description:
The Pikes Peak Marathon is a race like no other! With a 7,800 foot vertical climb, the course takes runners from Manitou Springs, Colorado, along Barr Trail to the summit of Pikes Peak at 14,115 feet, and back down for a total of 26.2 grueling mountain miles.

The course for the Marathon is unique and very physically demanding when compared to other marathons. Beginning in downtown Manitou Springs, the course proceeds along approximately 1.5 miles of road before joining into Pikes Peak's Barr Trail. This is where the real adventure begins. With an average grade of 11%, the trail is often narrow, winding, or steep and may be gravel, rock or dirt with sharp turns and abrupt changes in elevation or direction. However, there are no exposed ledges, so there is little danger of falling off the trail! Keep in mind, there is no vehicle access to most of Barr Trail, so to ensure the safety of our runners and volunteers, all participants are required to complete a qualifying event before registering.

Selected by the World Golden Trail Series as the North American race for the Champion Series, the Pikes Peak Marathon is the country‚Äôs most challenging marathon. Pikes Peak Marathon invites Elite Competitors, offers cash prizes to winners as well as free entries to past winners! Are you ready to take the challenge?

name: SWISS ALP 100 - 160K
description:
The 160KM is the longest and hardest race at the Swiss Alps 100. With a total elevation gain of 32,317 feet it sure will test runners to the max on the course.

The course being so challenging it helps a lot that you will be enjoying incredible views like running along the Aletsch Glacier, which is part of the UNESCO World Heritage, and traversing over the 124 meter (406 feet) Belalp-Riederalp suspension bridge , the 160 meter (524 feet) Aspi-Titter suspension bridge , and the 280 meter (918 feet) suspension bridge M√ºhlebach-F√ºrgangen .

After the Belalp aid station there is a tough out-and-back up to the hightest point of the course at 9150 feet above sea-level. The distance between the Reckingen and the Ch√§serstatt aid station is challenging because it has the longest distance of 10.4 miles and also has a 4330 feet uphill and then a 2729' downhill. And, of course, the prudal 3.2 miles and 3697 feet uphill after the Binn aid station going on top of the Breithorn. Lastly, after the Rossald aid station runners will go over the F√ºlhorn which has a very short but very technical section.

Finisher, who finish this course in less than 24 hours, will receive a sub-24 hour antic silver belt buckle. Whoever finish between 24 and 49 hours will receive a sub-48 hours antic brass belt buckle. We also give out female/male age group awards (18-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70+). And the DFL (very last finisher) will get a WhiteAlps Sport Rush-7 (black) hydration pack and a full-size version of a Hit!Balm product.

See the race weekend schedule page for the check-in and race starting times. The overall cutoff-time is 49 hours. Finishers are official qualifiers for the popular UTMB 100 miler UTMB 160km Qualifier, the oldest 100-miler in the USA Western States 100, and the prestigious Badwater 135.

name: ULTRA-TRAIL CAPE TOWN - 65KM
description:
The 65km Ultra is a front loaded route with a climb up Table Mountain followed by two significant climbs up Newlands Forest and Devil's Peak. The second half, while equal in elevation gain, consists of more sustained gradients.

The race starts in the early morning (5am) with an ascent out of the city to Signal Hill and around Lions Head, which captures the sights of the Atlantic Seaboard as the sun starts to rise. With the sun rising runners climb midway up Table Mountains north face and run a contour to Platteklip Gorge, the longest vertical ascent of the race- a notorious route with gradients exceeding 35 degrees, up Table Mountain. The climb is a long grind and loads the legs very early on in the race- after 15km an elevation of 1500m will have been covered.

Reaching the top you run the famous tabletop ridge with Cape Town at your feet. Traversing Table Mountain happens 10km later, with a 800m descent into Constantia marking halfway. The second half offers some flatter running through the historic Cape Wine Estates where they move through vineyards and city greenbelts.
‚Äã
Runners then depart the city slopes back for Table Mountain at Alphen Trail where they will climb through the technical sections of Cecilia forest and Newlands forest followed by a steep drop down into the University of Cape Town's upper campus(UCT Aid Station 55km). The final 10km, often into a strong headwind (the infamous 'Cape Doctor'), requires digging deep with an intense climb to get up to the Blockhouse and lower traverse of Devils Peak. Reaching it marks the home stretch, with the reward of incredible views of the City, the Atlantic Ocean, Table Mountain and Lions Head.
Running here above the City Bowl gives runners a moment to reflect, by retracing their footsteps along these famous landmarks covered in the morning.
‚Äã
Cut off Times
The 65km Ultra has a total duration of 15hrs 30min. Time-barriers for this race are lenient. Please consult the route info for cut-off times.
No qualification required.

name: ULTRA-TRAIL CAPE TOWN - 35KM
description:
The 35km Trail has two major climbs in Table Mountain (first half) and Devil's Peak(second half), the middle of the race consists mainly of technical descents with some flat run-able sections- take note along the Newlands contour of the climb known as the 400 stairs.

The race starts at 8am with a climb from Gardens Tech Rugby Club to Kloof Corner, a trail that puts runners midway up Table Mountain's north face. With the city at your feet, you run along the contour to Platteklip Gorge, the longest vertical ascent of the race- a notorious route with gradients exceeding 35 degrees, up Table Mountain. The climb is a long grind and loads the legs very early on in the race- after 7km an elevation of 900m will have been covered.
Reaching the top you run the famous tabletop ridge with Cape Town at your feet to Maclears Beacon, the highest point of the race - 1086m.
‚Äã
It is then on to Echo Valley, the Valley of Isolation and onward to the Scouts Hut next to the dams where the first Table Mountain Aid Station is located at 12km. The 35km splits from the 100km & 65km races at the end of Woodhead Dam where they make their way to Nursery Ravine which sees them rejoin the 100 & 65km races along the technical sections of Newlands forest followed by a steep drop down into the University of Cape Town's upper campus (UCT Aid station -26.2km). The final 10km, often into a strong headwind (the infamous 'Cape Doctor'), requires digging deep with an intense climb to get up to the Blockhouse and lower traverse of Devils Peak. Reaching it marks the home stretch, with the reward of incredible views of the City, the Atlantic Ocean, Table Mountain and Lions Head.

Running here above the City Bowl gives runners a moment to reflect, by retracing their footsteps along these famous landmarks covered in the morning.
Cutoff Time: 11:00hours
No Qualification required

name: ULTRA-TRAIL CAPE TOWN - 21KM
description:
UTCT's 21km is a gateway to Ultra-trail running.

Starting at 8am on the Sunday of race weekend, runners head out along the lower jeep and single tracks of Devil's Peak. It's a relatively easy start and runners will be gifted awesome views of the City as they head towards UCT.

Before getting to Rhodes Memorial the rolling jeep and single tracks provide fast and flowing running at times. You then descend into the savannah like section of Rhodes Memorial where you will run along amazing single tracks and through lonely pines. Climbing past Rhodes Memorial it's worth stopping for a second to admire the view before you head down to UCT and your only Aid station at 10km. UCT has become an oasis for runners in all 3 races at UTCT and for the 21km it is no different. Be sure to take some time to fill up because the personality of the 21km is about to change.

From UCT runners head up and out towards Newlands forest before beginning a slow climb towards the contour path, upon reaching the contour path you'll head along it for about 2km before the biggest climb of the day will greet you, Newlands Ravine. It has sections that are 47% gradient but generally it's a fairly steady climb which tops out between Devil's Peak on your right and Table Mountain on your left. It's a gradual descent to Saddle rock before traversing across and onto a fairly technical descent which should bother tired legs. As you make your way down to the Contour Path be sure to look up and see the finish way down below.

The descent of Platteklip from the contour path will be a rough section for some but it'll soon pass with thoughts of home in your mind as you descend via the boardwalks and onto tar for the last 500m to the finish at Gardens Rugby Club.

21km
1100m D+
Cut off is at 14:30 giving runners a healthy 6hrs 30 minutes to complete the route.
No Qualification required

name: ULTRA-TRAIL HARRICANA OF CANADA‚Ñ¢ - UTHC 125
description:
A remote and authentic ultra race deep in the Canadian wilderness

The 125 km Ultra-Trail Harricana of Canada‚Ñ¢ is a linear course that weaves through the mountains, lakes, rivers, and boreal forests of the Charlevoix region. Most of the course is singletrack, often enmeshed with rocks and roots. For this reason, vigilance is required from start to finish. Although the beginning of the trail is technical and strenuous, there are a fair number of rolling sections. It makes for a challenging and rigorous course, however, also, entirely runnable.

The course summits four peaks. The first, Mount Lac-√†-l‚ÄôEmp√™che, then Mount Morios ‚Äì which offers breathtaking views of the region -, followed by Mount Noy√©e ‚Äì which has the profile of a woman floating on water -, and finally Montagne Noire (Black Mountain), which after the descent, marks the final stretch to the finish line at Grand-Fonds Mountain ski resort area.

Don‚Äôt underestimate the difficulty of this course. In fact, since it‚Äôs inception in 2016, only slightly more than half of the participants who toed the line managed to also cross the finish line.

The UTHC 80 is the perfect stepping stone for athletes who aspire to one day run the UTHC 125

This is the only race in which runners are allowed pacers, (from the SPLIT aid station).

The 65km is one our most popular events in the Ultra-Trail Harricana of Canada‚Ñ¢. It is a perfect gateway race to ease into longer ultra distances. An early morning start at the Hautes-Gorges Park entrance, which happens to be the halfway point for the 125km event, guarantees stunning views as it follows the Malbaie River before venturing into the mountains and winding along singletracks that weave their way through the evergreens.

The top athletes run fast from start to finish, (winning in 5 hours and 30 minutes despite the 1900m D+), where race management is critical if you want to perform well. The trails and generally interwoven with roots and require extreme vigilance.

name: ULTRA-TRAIL HARRICANA OF CANADA‚Ñ¢ - UTHC 42

The 42 km is a real ‚Äúclassic‚Äù of the Ultra-Trail Harricana of Canada‚Ñ¢

This course has become a classic favourite. It is our most popular race and tends to sell out early!

This event takes place on a fast-paced course starting with the ascent of Mont Grand-Fonds leading onto the Orignac trail toward La Montagne Noire.

Give into temptation!

name: SALOMON CAPPADOCIA ULTRA-TRAIL¬Æ - CMT 63

name: JAVELINA JUNDRED 100M
description:
The 100-mile course will incorporate five loops on the Shallmo, Pemberton & Cinch trails, with part of the first loop also being on the Escondido Trail. Trails feature rolling single track through the Sonoran Desert. Run past giant Saguaro Cactus, granite boulders, and dry wash-beds as you tour the most popular trail McDowell Mountain Regional Park. 100-kilometer runners will complete 3 loops and the Jackass 31k will be a single loop.
Each loop features a gentle climb from the start/finish at Javelina Jeadquarters to the high point near the foothills of the McDowell Mountain range (with total gain for each loop of approximately 1,580 ft). The trail dips in and out of wash beds on the far side of the course before descending back to the start finish. The trail is a mix of hard packed granite, rocks and sand.
The 100 Mile & 100 Km will utilize the same two loops. On loop one shortly after the Rattlesnake Ranch aid station, you will turn left on a junction with the Escondido Trail and run a slightly longer way around back to Jeadquarters. On all subsequent loops, you‚Äôll go straight through that junction. The 100 Km is 3 loops total. The 100 Mile is 5 loops total.

name: JAVELINA JUNDRED - JACKASS 31K
description: The 31K course is a single loop of the shorter of the two loops utilized in the ultra distance races. You‚Äôll stay straight on that Escondido junction and run a similar course to loops 2-5 of the 100 mile.

name: KULLAMANNEN - ULTRA 100 MILES
description:
‚ÄúHEAVEN, SEA & HELL‚Äù THE PURE SCANIAN TRAIL ADVENTURE

A +100-mile long course along two fantastic nature reserves with an end at the magical Kullaberg nature reserve. The course runs along beautiful ridges coastal paths. When the day is over, you have travelled about 100 miles and got a lot of slopes in your legs, more specifically about 4300 altitude metres.
The track runs along the Sk√•neleden trail. Norrviken ‚Äì Hovs Hallar ‚Äì Torekov ‚Äì √Ñngelholm ‚Äì Arild ‚Äì Kullens Fyr ‚Äì M√∂lle. In Arild you will enter the gateway of D√∂dens Zon (the Death Zone), totally drained of energy. The track is quite complex in all its simplicity. But its not easy anymore. In the darkness you can hear the waves and a chilling feeling of the abyss.

It is a very technical trail that leaves no one untouched! Parts of it go on open cliff tops like on the Isle of Sky, Dragons back in Wales. Sometimes you jump as a mountain goat or gasp after air as at the Everest. At other times it is like the old drowning sailor ghosts wants to pull you into the abyss and with your last breath you fight against burning lactic acid in your sore legs.

At the lighthouse you see the light and the harbor of M√∂lle feels close, in your imagination you can feel the aroma of barbecue and at the last 1200 metres along the old beach road with the salt splash from the sea on your right. But this is not the end. It‚Äôs the beginning of the race. There is three more 22 km laps to go.

70% DNF rate is to be expected. Failure is much more common than success. You will get two support stations where you can use your drop-bags, in √Ñngelholm 55 km and M√∂lle about 100 km. There will also be water supply in about every 30 km.

A Kiwi described the course this way:
‚ÄùThis was a monster, a slayer of strong men and women‚Äù

Another runners says:
‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre in it, you think its madness. Afterwards you want more.

Welcome to one of the most challenging and beautiful +100 mile race in Scandinavia.

‚ÄúIt is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.‚Äù
/Ernest Hemingway

name: Kullamannen by UTMB¬Æ ULTRA 100 KM
description:
Donde la leyenda y el trail se encuentran

El Kullamannen by UTMB¬Æ, celebrado en la pen√≠nsula de Kullaberg, Suecia, es mucho m√°s que una carrera de trail running: es una experiencia que combina la belleza salvaje del Mar B√°ltico con un recorrido legendario que desaf√≠a tanto el cuerpo como la mente. Reconocido como parte de las prestigiosas UTMB¬Æ World Series, este evento atrae a corredores de todo el mundo que buscan enfrentarse a los elementos y descubrir la esencia del trail running en su forma m√°s pura.

La pen√≠nsula de Kullaberg, con su costa escarpada, bosques densos y paisajes llenos de misticismo, proporciona un entorno √∫nico para los amantes de las carreras de monta√±a. Tradici√≥n y comunidad

Kullamannen no solo es famoso por su desaf√≠o f√≠sico, sino tambi√©n por su singular enfoque en el esp√≠ritu de comunidad. Las ceremonias previas y posteriores a la carrera rinden homenaje a las ra√≠ces vikingas de la regi√≥n, uniendo a los corredores en torno a una experiencia que trasciende el deporte.

Un desaf√≠o para todos los niveles

El evento ofrece diferentes distancias, desde √©picas ultras hasta recorridos m√°s accesibles, asegurando que haya algo para todos. Sin importar el nivel, cada carrera comparte la misma esencia: un desaf√≠o aut√©ntico en un entorno extraordinario.

Vive el Kullamannen

Correr el Kullamannen by UTMB¬Æ es enfrentarse a un reto que pone a prueba la resistencia f√≠sica, la fuerza mental y el amor por la naturaleza. Es una experiencia que combina historia, aventura y comunidad, dejando una huella imborrable en todos los que se atreven a enfrentarse a este desaf√≠o √∫nico.

El Kullamannen te espera con los brazos abiertos. Corre por la gloria, corre por la aventura y corre para escribir tu propia historia en los senderos legendarios de Suecia.

name: KULLAMANNEN - SIBIRIEN ULTRA 50 KM
description:
THE COASTAL SPEED ULTRA

The path goes through winding pine forest trails in an area known as Siberia locally. It is believed that a UFO landed there on May 18, 1946. The ‚ÄúPollen King‚Äù G√∂sta Carlsson, who witnessed the incident, claims to have created his business thanks to the extraterrestrials. One can therefore say that the local hockey club R√∂gle BK also comes from outer space.

When you pass Siberia, you will come to the small village of Jonstorp. You will run through a couple of nature reserves and a suspension bridge passage. Don‚Äôt fall in to the water! In Svanshall you will follow the stoneworkers old trail but prepare for a dramatic change. You will soon enter Arild and the gateway to D√∂dens Zon (the Death Zone). With 35 easy kilometres in your legs you will soon realize that its not easy anymore. Its now the race really begins with technical steep hills, stony paths and slippery roots. The daylight will be fading at this time, but if you are strong enough you will reach the lighthouse before dawn. If not, the darkness will delay your journey, but who really cares? The longer time at the mountain, the longer pleasure.

name: KULLAMANNEN - D√ñDENS ZON 22 KM
description:
22 KM OF DEMANDING TRAIL ‚Äì PUSHING YOU TO YOUR LIMITS

Parts of the course passed by mores as on Isle of Skye. Passing the Dragon‚Äôs back, the Hill of death, Nimis, while jumping from one stone to another makes runners gasp for air while trying to take it all in. The next second it feels like the old drowned seamen, the ‚ÄúStrandvaskarna‚Äù, are trying to pull you down into the abyss. You are struggling with numb legs pumped with lactic acid. By Kullens Lighthouse you can see the light from M√∂lle harbor. You fantasize about what‚Äôs on today‚Äôs grill menu, you can almost scent it. The last 1200 meters along the old beach road with that salty south west wind gently caressing your right cheek quickly turns into euphoria listening to the applause and cheering from the crowd. A feeling you will never forget.

name: LMIT¬Æ LAGO MAGGIORE INTERNATIONAL TRAIL - K55
LMIT¬Æ LAGO MAGGIORE INTERNATIONAL TRAIL - K20
LMIT¬Æ LAGO MAGGIORE INTERNATIONAL TRAIL - K12
INNSBRUCK ALPINE TRAILRUN FESTIVAL - K110
description: DIE STRECKE: Bereit f√ºr den K110 zum Saisonstart mit Altschnee, Spikes und dadurch sicher einigen √úberraschungen hier und da? Denn das Feedback der L√§uferInnen war eindeutig: Unser K110 hat es richtig in sich und 2022 dann auch noch fr√ºh im Jahr üòâ. Da leider noch nicht sichergestellt ist, dass wir 2022 wieder auf den Landestheater Vorplatz ziehen k√∂nnen, gehen wir aktuell von einer erneuten Austragung in der Olympiaworld aus. Also geht‚Äôs nach dem Start direkt wieder in die wundervolle Sillschlucht und hinauf nach Telfes, wo die erste Labe auf Euch wartet. Jetzt gewinnt Ihr an H√∂he bis hin zur n√§chsten Versorgung auf der Mutterer Alm und dem Speichersee. Als N√§chstes folgt ein Abschnitt, der als Knackpunkt im Fr√ºhjahr gilt und oft wegen Altschnee und Lawinengefahr nicht gelaufen werden konnte: der G√∂tzner Graben und der Downhill hinunter zur Versorgung in Birgitz. Also fingers crossed, dass es 2022 m√∂glich sein wird. Durch das Inntal geht es zur Nordkette. Hier warten kurze, knackige und technische Up- und Downhills bis hin zur Versorgung H√∂ttinger Bild, wo Euer Dropbag auf Euch wartet. Ihr passiert die Umbr√ºggler Alm, die Arzler Alm, das Thaurer Schl√∂ssl und die Versorgung Romediwirt. Nach der Versorgung in der mittelalterlichen Altstadt Hall erreicht Ihr nach wenigen Kilometern die Versorgung am Herzsee, an der Ihr Euch von den K85ern trennt. Die H√§rtepr√ºfung zum Ende ist der letzte Uphill mit 8 km und √ºber 1.100 hm. Der Zirbensteig hoch √ºber Innsbruck ist die verdiente Belohnung und im Fr√ºhjahr wohl noch voller Schnee. Spart Euch ein paar K√∂rner f√ºr den Downhill zur Versorgung Heiligwasser, ehe es weiter hinunter Richtung Innsbruck und schlie√ülich ins Ziel geht.

name: Innsbruck Alpine Trailrun Festival  85K
description:
Donde la naturaleza y la historia se encuentran

El Innsbruck Alpine Trailrun Festival es una de las competiciones de trail running m√°s ic√≥nicas de los Alpes austriacos. Celebrado en la ciudad de Innsbruck, un punto de encuentro entre la tradici√≥n alpina y el dinamismo moderno, este evento ofrece una experiencia inolvidable para corredores de todos los niveles. Su fama no solo radica en sus impresionantes recorridos, sino tambi√©n en el esp√≠ritu acogedor de una ciudad que respira monta√±a y aventura.

La belleza de los Alpes tiroleses

Desde el casco hist√≥rico de Innsbruck, los participantes se embarcan en una traves√≠a que los lleva a descubrir los espectaculares paisajes de los Alpes tiroleses. Cada ruta combina senderos alpinos, verdes praderas y bosques m√°gicos, ofreciendo vistas de ensue√±o de picos majestuosos y valles profundos. Los corredores tendr√°n la oportunidad de recorrer el famoso Karwendelgebirge y disfrutar de panor√°micas que dejan sin aliento.

Un evento para todos

Con una variedad de distancias y recorridos, el Innsbruck Alpine Trailrun Festival es perfecto tanto para principiantes como para corredores experimentados. Desde desaf√≠os √©picos en alta monta√±a hasta rutas m√°s accesibles para quienes se est√°n iniciando en el trail running, este evento asegura que cada participante viva una experiencia adaptada a sus capacidades y expectativas.

Las rutas est√°n cuidadosamente dise√±adas para mostrar lo mejor del entorno alpino y, al mismo tiempo, ofrecer a los corredores un desaf√≠o t√©cnico que eleve su pasi√≥n por este deporte.

Historia, cultura y hospitalidad

Innsbruck no solo es conocida por sus paisajes, sino tambi√©n por su historia y cultura √∫nicas. Participar en esta competici√≥n significa tambi√©n sumergirse en una ciudad que ha sido anfitriona de eventos hist√≥ricos y deportivos de talla mundial. Los corredores pueden pasear por sus calles empedradas, explorar sus mercados y disfrutar de la famosa hospitalidad tirolesa.

El ambiente festivo del evento, con la comunidad local alentando y apoyando a los corredores, es una de las caracter√≠sticas que hacen que el Innsbruck Alpine Trailrun Festival sea tan especial.

Un viaje que trasciende la competici√≥n

El Innsbruck Alpine Trailrun Festival no es solo una carrera; es una experiencia que conecta a los corredores con la esencia de los Alpes y la cultura tirolesa. Vivir esta competici√≥n significa mucho m√°s que superar un reto deportivo: es descubrir la belleza de la naturaleza, el calor de una comunidad apasionada y la magia de los Alpes.
